1.verse: The prophecy ( A ) that Habakkuk the prophet received.

2.verse: How long, ( B ) Lord , must I call for help,

3.verse: Why do you make me look at injustice?

4.verse: Therefore the law ( I ) is paralyzed,

6.verse: I am raising up the Babylonians,  ( N )

7.verse: They are a feared and dreaded people; ( Q )

8.verse: Their horses are swifter ( R ) than leopards,

9.verse: they all come intent on violence.

11.verse: Then they sweep past like the wind ( W ) and go on—

12.verse: Lord , are you not from everlasting? ( Y )

13.verse: Your eyes are too pure ( AD ) to look on evil;

14.verse: You have made people like the fish in the sea,

15.verse: The wicked ( AI ) foe pulls all of them up with hooks, ( AJ )

16.verse: Therefore he sacrifices to his net

17.verse: Is he to keep on emptying his net,

1.verse: I will stand at my watch ( A )

3.verse: For the revelation awaits an appointed time; ( F )

6.verse: “Will not all of them taunt ( P ) him with ridicule and scorn, saying,

7.verse: Will not your creditors suddenly arise?

8.verse: Because you have plundered many nations,

9.verse: “Woe to him who builds ( V ) his house by unjust gain, ( W )

10.verse: You have plotted the ruin ( Y ) of many peoples,

11.verse: The stones ( AA ) of the wall will cry out,

12.verse: “Woe to him who builds a city with bloodshed ( AB )

13.verse: Has not the Lord Almighty determined

14.verse: For the earth will be filled with the knowledge of the glory ( AE ) of the Lord

15.verse: “Woe to him who gives drink ( AG ) to his neighbors,

16.verse: You will be filled with shame ( AH ) instead of glory. ( AI )

17.verse: The violence ( AM ) you have done to Lebanon will overwhelm you,

18.verse: “Of what value ( AP ) is an idol ( AQ ) carved by a craftsman?

19.verse: Woe to him who says to wood, ‘Come to life!’

20.verse: The Lord is in his holy temple; ( AW )

1.verse: A prayer of Habakkuk the prophet. On shigionoth .  ( A )

2.verse: Lord , I have heard ( B ) of your fame;

4.verse: His splendor was like the sunrise; ( L )

6.verse: He stood, and shook the earth;

7.verse: I saw the tents of Cushan in distress,

8.verse: Were you angry with the rivers, ( U ) Lord ?

10.verse: the mountains saw you and writhed. ( Y )

11.verse: Sun and moon stood still ( AB ) in the heavens

12.verse: In wrath you strode through the earth

13.verse: You came out ( AF ) to deliver ( AG ) your people,

14.verse: With his own spear you pierced his head

15.verse: You trampled the sea ( AL ) with your horses,

16.verse: I heard and my heart pounded,

17.verse: Though the fig tree does not bud

18.verse: yet I will rejoice in the Lord , ( AR )

19.verse: The Sovereign Lord is my strength; ( AT )
